thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Tuesday, 20 Feb 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: BRIEF-Dunelm Group Expects FY Operating Costs To Grow Slightly Ahead Of Sales

author: Reuters Editorial
title: BRIEF-Dunelm Group Expects FY Operating Costs To Grow Slightly Ahead Of Sales
text:
Feb 20 (Reuters) - Dunelm Group Plc:
* INTERIM DIVIDEND UP 7.7 PERCENT TO 7 PENCEPER SHARE * H1 ‍EBTIDA (POST EXCEPTIONAL ITEMS) OF £76.4M UP 7% YEAR-ON-YEAR​
* ‍INTERIM DIVIDEND INCREASED BY 7.7% TO 7.0 PENCE PER SHARE (FY17: 6.5 PENCE PER SHARE)​
* H1 PBT PRE-EXCEPTIONAL ITEMS DOWN 8.0% TO £60.0M, AND UP 0.7% TO £56.3M POST-EXCEPTIONAL COSTS
* GOOD SALES GROWTH; 6.0% LIKE-FOR-LIKE (LFL) SALES GROWTH, INCLUDING STORE LFL SALES GROWTH OF 3.5%, AND 18.4% TOTAL GROWTH IN H1
* WE ARE BUILDING TOWARDS OUR MEDIUM TERM REVENUE TARGET OF £2BN, OF WHICH 30-40% WILL BE ONLINE
* OUR GROSS MARGIN IS EXPECTED TO BE MORE STABLE IN SECOND HALF
* WE EXPECT OPERATING COSTS TO GROW SLIGHTLY AHEAD OF SALES IN FULL YEAR Source text for Eikon: Further company coverage:
